Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Humdrum \Hum"drum`\, a. Monotonous; dull; commonplace. ``A humdrum crone.'' --Bryant. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Humdrum \Hum"drum`\, n. 1. A dull fellow; a bore. --B. Jonson. [1913 Webster]
2. Monotonous and tedious routine. [1913 Webster]
Dissatisfied with humdrum. --The Nation. [1913 Webster]
3. A low cart with three wheels, drawn by one horse.

humdrum adj 1: not challenging; dull and lacking excitement; "an unglamorous job greasing engines" [syn: {commonplace}, {prosaic}, {unglamorous}, {unglamourous}] 2: tediously repetitious or lacking in variety; "a humdrum existence; all work and no play"; "nothing is so monotonous as the sea" [syn: {monotonous}]
